cards.name: Abyssal Stalker
cards.text:
Whenever Abyssal Stalker attacks, defending player discards a card at random.
When Abyssal Stalker dies, you may choose a creature. If you do, exile Abyssal Stalker. When the chosen creature leaves the battlefield, return Abyssal Stalker from exile to the battlefield tapped.

cards.name: Adaptive Servitor
cards.text:
{1}: Choose one. Activate only once each turn.
• Adaptive Servitor gets +1/+1 and gains first strike until end of turn.
• Adaptive Servitor gets +2/+0 and gains trample until end of turn.

cards.flavor: His spear flows like the tides and strikes as fierce as a shark's bite.
cards.name: Adept of Waves
cards.text: Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

cards.flavor: Only one solider is needed to hold the front.
cards.name: Aegis Champion
cards.text: {1}{W}: Aegis Champion gains indestructible until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
“Remember Daril, no matter what you might think about our targets, we never draw their deaths out. We're not savages.”
—Amela, Aeon's Hand Assassin
cards.name: Aeon's Hand Cutthroat

rulings.text: If Aeon's Hand Cutthroat is already blocked, activating it's ability won't make it unblocked.

cards.text: {1}{U}: Aeon's Hand Cutthroat can't be blocked this turn.

cards.name: Aiel's Fury

rulings.text: In the case of multiple libraries, the same library will be used for the scry and reveal effects.

cards.text:
Menace, haste
Whenever Aiel's Fury attacks, scry 2, then reveal the top card of your library. Aiel's Fury gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is that card's mana value.

cards.name: Aiel Tazan
cards.text:
[+1]: Aiel Tazan deals 2 damage to any target. Then she deals 2 damage to herself unless you have her deal 2 damage to you.
[-3]: Creatures you control get +2/+0 and gain haste until end of turn.
[-X]: Create an X/1 red Elemental creature token with haste and trample. Exile that token at the beginning of the next end step. If X is 6 or more, it gains double strike.

cards.flavor: Once he wrote his liturgies in paper and song. Now he writes them in blood and death.
cards.name: Aldrane, Insane Necromancer
cards.text: {2}{B}, {T}, Discard a card: Create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token. If a noncreature card was discarded this way, that token enters the battlefield tapped.

cards.flavor:
“Think about it this way: has one really seen a young bear corpse before?”
—Mavisa
cards.name: Ancient Grizzly
Ancient Saber
cards.text:
Equipped creature has “Whenever this creature attacks or blocks, choose a creature card in your graveyard. This creature gets +X/+Y until end of turn, where X is that card's power and Y is its toughness.”
Equip {2}

cards.flavor: It had stood treacheries, invasions, and even the fall of the civilization that built it.
cards.name: Ancient Statue

cards.flavor: Bringing a whole new meaning to “a frog in your throat.”
cards.name: Anurafication
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature loses all abilities and is a blue Frog creature with base power and toughness 1/1.

cards.flavor: “Eh, at least he's trying.”
cards.name: Apprentice Summoner
cards.text: When Apprentice Summoner enters the battlefield, search your library for a creature card with mana value 1 or less, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle.

cards.name: Arcanum Owl
cards.text:
Flying
When Arcanum Owl enters the battlefield, you may return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Arden, Mirrormage
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Arden, Mirrormage during your untap step.
Whenever Arden becomes untapped or leaves the battlefield, sacrifice all tokens created with it.
{3}{U}, {T}: Create a token that's a copy of another creature on the battlefield.

cards.name: Aspect of Rage
cards.text:
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to a player, you may have Aspect of Rage deal 1 damage to any target.

cards.flavor:
“Nothing personal, but my superiors deemed you too valuable for you to keep your life like this.”
—Daril Tique
cards.name: Assassinate
cards.text: Destroy target tapped creature.

cards.name: Astral Dynamo
cards.text:
Whenever you cast a spell, put a charge counter on Astral Dynamo.
{T}, Remove any number of charge counters from Astral Dynamo: Add that much {C}.

cards.flavor:
“The best instruction for an Atdrik? Point em towards a foe and watch them go.”
—Ziras, Verendas Elf
cards.name: Atdrik Ravager
cards.text: Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, you may pay {2}{G}. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on Atdrik Ravager.

cards.name: Audacious Knight
cards.text: {2}{W}: Audacious Knight gains first strike and vigilance until end of turn. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike. Attacking does not cause it to tap.)

cards.name: Automated Blademaster
cards.text: When Automated Blademaster enters the battlefield, create a colorless Equipment artifact token named Sword with “Equipped creature gets +1/+1” and equip {1} and attach it to Automated Blademaster.

cards.flavor: A proper army is a single being, capable of healing from its wounds just like any soldier.
cards.name: Backup Forces
cards.text: At the beginning of your end step, create a 1/1 white Soldier creature token.

cards.name: Battle Tactics
cards.text: Creatures you control get +2/+1 until end of turn. Scry 1.

cards.flavor:
“My faith is more than just sitting down and spouting empty words; it's about fighting for the people you want to protect.”
—Tobias, Priest of Vaea
cards.name: Battlefield Priest
cards.text: Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

cards.name: Blade of the Many
cards.text:
Blade of the Many can be attached only to a nonlegendary creature.
Equipped creature gets +2/+2.
Each other creature you own is a copy of equipped creature.
Effects that would cause permanents you own to become creatures cause them to become copies of equipped creature instead.
Equip {6}

cards.flavor: With a whirl and a twirl, her blades sing of her prowess and her enemy's utter demise.
cards.name: Bladesinger
cards.text: Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

cards.name: Blood Fiend
cards.text:
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
Blood Fiend can't block.
{1}{B}, Pay 3 life: Return Blood Fiend from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste.

cards.name: Bloodfire Phoenix
cards.text:
Flying, haste
{1}{R}{R}: Return Bloodfire Phoenix from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate only if an opponent lost 3 or more life this turn.

cards.name: Bloodfont Ritualist
cards.text:
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
At the beginning of each end step, if you lost life this turn, you may pay {1}. If you do, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.

cards.flavor:
“He's psychotic, depraved, and addicted to battle. I like him. Send him to the arena at once!”
—Odron, Master of Kayur Colosseo
cards.name: Bloodrage Gladiator
Bloodstone Halls
cards.text:
Bloodstone Halls enters the battlefield tapped unless you control two or more black and/or red permanents.
{T}: Add {B} or {R}.

cards.name: Brain Static
cards.text: Counter target spell. Spells its controller casts cost {2} more to cast this turn.

cards.flavor: When the Nald Plains becomes covered in snow, many nomads journey through the Natia Pass for warmer climes.
cards.name: Brave the Frontier
cards.text: You may play an additional land this turn. Scry 1.

cards.flavor: “We pledge our undying loyalty to you, Sir Gavis. What is your command?”
cards.name: Captain's Call
cards.text: Create three 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens.

cards.name: Carved Dagger
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+1.
Equip {1}

cards.name: Caustic Lurker
cards.text: When Caustic Lurker dies, target player loses 1 life.

cards.flavor: She tugged on the creature's hatred like a puppet on a string.
cards.name: Channel Enmity
cards.text: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gets +1/-1 and gains haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Charbelcher
cards.text: {R}: Charbelcher gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Commune With Nature
cards.text: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal a creature card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.flavor: Sometimes, it helps to get a new perspective on things.
cards.name: Concenter
cards.text: Shuffle your hand into your library, then draw X cards.

cards.flavor: “Ah yes, the blood of an ordinary peasant is filling enough, but the blood of a terrified noble is... much more satisfying.”
cards.name: Consort of Blood
cards.text:
Menace
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

cards.flavor: Out of many, one.
cards.name: Convergence Colossus
cards.text:
You may pay {W}{U}{B}{R}{G} rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Flying, first strike, vigilance, trample, lifelink

cards.name: Convergent Might
cards.text: For each nonland permanent you control, you may create a token that's a copy of it. If it's a creature, it gains haste. Exile all tokens created this way at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.flavor: Who knows what darkness lurks in the heart of the woods? She knows.
cards.name: Copse Watcher
cards.text: Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

cards.flavor: No matter the plane, dark bargains for power always come at a deadly price.
cards.name: Corrupted Strength
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/-2.

cards.flavor: Hidden within the esoteric etchings lies secrets only known to the ancients.
cards.name: Crude Tablet
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Draw a card. Crude Tablet doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

cards.flavor:
“Everyday, the Great Blizzard takes more of our world. And with it, our hope as well.”
—Azai, Renegade Mage
cards.name: Crumbling Vestige
cards.text:
Crumbling Vestige enters the battlefield tapped.
When Crumbling Vestige enters the battlefield, add one mana of any color.
{T}: Add {C}.

cards.name: Damned Deal
cards.text:
When Damned Deal enters the battlefield, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
{B}, Sacrifice Damned Deal: You draw a card and you lose 1 life.

cards.name: Daril, Agent of Time
cards.text:
[+1]: Until your next upkeep, creatures can't attack you or planeswalkers you control unless their controller pays 2 for each of those creatures.
[-2]: Look at the top two cards of target player's library. Put any number of them on top of that library and the rest on the bottom in any order.
[-6]: Return all nonland permanents you don't control to their owners' hands.

cards.name: Daril's Timewalker
cards.text: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, exile Daril's Timewalker and up to one other target nonland permanent you control, then return those cards to the battlefield under their owner's control.

cards.flavor: He seeks no glory, fame, or material possessions. All he seeks is more reasons to protect the defenseless.
cards.name: Dauntless Piker
Daybreak Justicar
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever a creature you don't control blocks, it gets -1/-0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Death comes for all.
cards.name: Death Strike

rulings.text: You can't cast Death Strike unless it has four targets.

cards.text: Destroy four target creatures.

cards.name: Depths of Solitude
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -3/-0.
Spells that target enchanted creature cost {1} more to cast.

cards.name: Divine Ascension
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Divine Ascension enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1 and has flying.

cards.flavor: With this crown, may all bend to your whims.
cards.name: Dominion Crown
cards.text:
You have hexproof.
Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, you may tap or untap target permanent.

cards.name: Dracosoul
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying and “{R}: This creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.”

cards.flavor: “Guilty.”
cards.name: Due Judgement
cards.text: Destroy target creature that dealt damage to a creature you control this turn.

cards.flavor: Madness is the sword that cuts deep and leaves a lasting scar.
cards.name: Edge of Madness
cards.text: Target player discards a card. If that player discards a land card this way, they lose 3 life.

cards.name: Elegant Fireslinger
cards.text:
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, you may have Elegant Fireslinger deal 1 damage to target creature.

cards.name: Ember Salvo
cards.text: Ember Salvo deals 1 damage to target creature and 1 damage to its controller.

cards.name: Ensnaring Vines
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has reach. (It can block creatures with flying)
{G}, Sacrifice Ensnaring Vines: Tap target creature with flying.

cards.flavor: It awakes in the first spring sun, and takes root in places devastated by winter's hold.
cards.name: Envoy of Growth
cards.text: When Envoy of Growth enters the battlefield, search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.

cards.name: Erase from Existence
cards.text: Exile target creature and all other creatures with the same name as that creature. Search its controller's graveyard, hand and library for any number of cards with the same name as that creature and exile them. Then that player shuffles. Exile Erase from Existence.

cards.flavor: His roots were planted long before the first sprouts and will remain long after the forest perishes.
cards.name: Eternal Oak
cards.text:
Eternal Oak gets +1/+1 for each creature you control.
Whenever a nontoken creature you control dies, create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.

cards.name: Exclude
cards.text:
Counter target creature spell.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Fates Foretold
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, scry 1. (To scry 1, look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

cards.flavor: First, there was an uproar. Then, a thunderous din. Then, naught but the wails of the lowly remained.
cards.name: Fell the Haughty
cards.text: Each player chooses a creature with the least power among creatures they control. Then destroy the rest.

cards.flavor: Atdrik domestication only started recently, and only after the sacrifice of some brave Verendian elves.
cards.name: Feral Atdrik
cards.text: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)

cards.flavor: Bold, daring, and just a little bit reckless; the perfect traits for a leader of armies.
cards.name: Fervent Sergeant
cards.text: Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.

cards.name: Festering Shambler
cards.text: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

cards.name: Focus Thoughts
cards.text: Draw three cards, then put a card from your hand on the bottom of your library.

cards.name: Forbidden Truths
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard a card.
Search your library for a card with mana value X or less, where X is 1 plus the discarded card's mana value, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.

cards.flavor:
“A wonder of artifice fallen to some simple roots and leaves? Pathetic.”
—Vira, Botanomancer
cards.name: Forced Sprouting
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.

cards.name: Freezing Maelstrom
cards.text: Creatures you don't control get -3/-0 until end of turn. Those creatures don't untap during their controller's next untap step.

cards.name: Galeforce
cards.text: Return target creature to its owner's hand. You may have another target creature gain flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Gavis's Dragoons

rulings.text: If Gavis's Dragoon's ability is copied, spells with the same name as any of the cards exiled with its enters the battlefield ability will be exiled.

cards.text:
First strike
When Gavis's Dragoons enters the battlefield, exile another target creature until Gavis's Dragoons leaves the battlefield.
Spells with the same name as the exiled card can't be cast (as long as this creature is on the battlefield.)

cards.name: Gavis the Stalwart

rulings.text: Gavis's emblem will trigger if that permanent entered an opponents graveyard as long as you controlled that permanent.

cards.text:
[+1]: Creatures you control get +0/+1 until your next upkeep. Untap those creatures.
[-2]: Put target tapped creature into its owner's library third from the top.
[-7]: You get an emblem with “Whenever a nonland permanent you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, each opponent sacrifices a nonland permanent.”

cards.flavor: Goblins never mug alone.
cards.name: Goblin Cutpurses
cards.text: When Goblin Cutpurses enters the battlefield, target player discards a card, then draws a card.

cards.flavor: He'll die for the cause, as long as he knows what the cause is.
cards.name: Goblin Squire
cards.text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

cards.flavor:
“Thusly, all personages not of human blood are naught but refuse in the eyes of this great city and must be dealt as such.”
—Mandates of Goldhill, vol XI
cards.name: Goldhill Enforcer
cards.text: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.

cards.name: Goldhill Guardian
cards.text:
When Goldhill Guardian enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
Goldhill Guardian has protection from creatures of the chosen type. (It can't be blocked, targeted or dealt damage by creatures of the chosen type.)

cards.name: Gossamer Veil
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

cards.name: Grave Revenant
cards.text:
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
When Grave Revenant enters the battlefield, target opponent loses life equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard.

cards.flavor: The noblest acts of love require a noble sacrifice.
cards.name: Harm's Way
cards.text: The next 2 damage that a source of your choice would deal to you and/or permanents you control this turn is dealt to any target instead.

cards.flavor: It is said a falcon only responds to a heart untamed and free as theirs.
cards.name: Harrier's Falcon
cards.text:
Flying
Harrier's Falcon can't attack or block alone.

cards.flavor: Under its wheat gold light, prosperity and plenty abound.
cards.name: Harvest Moon
cards.text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds one mana of any color.

cards.flavor: “The will of fire courses through me and through me, my strength.”
cards.name: Hav'za, Itavan Warchief
cards.text:
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever another noncreature source deals damage to a creature or player, you may have Hav'za, Itavan Warchief deal half that damage, rounded up, to any target.

cards.name: Healer's Knack
cards.text: You gain 5 life, then you may regenerate target creature. (The next time this would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it.)

cards.flavor: When you are above the clouds, earthly matters seem like mere trifles.
cards.name: Heavens Above
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying and can only block creatures with flying.

cards.name: Hill of Souls
cards.text:
Whenever a creature you control dies, put a soul counter on Hill of Souls.
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}, Remove a soul counter from Hill of Souls: Add one mana of any color.

cards.name: Illusionary Steed
cards.text:
Flying
When Illusionary Steed becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it.

cards.flavor: Of many parts lies a single unified whole.
cards.name: In Arms
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has “Whenever this creature attacks, if there are at least two other attacking creatures, this creature gains +2/+2 until end of turn.”

cards.name: Infernal Invocation
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has “{R}, {T}: Create an X/1 red Elemental creature token with haste and trample, where X is this creature's power. Exile that token at the beginning of the next end step.”

cards.name: Inferno Forerunner
cards.text:
Haste
When Inferno Forerunner enters the battlefield, you may have target creature gain haste until end of turn.

cards.flavor: The Ironsmash clan is shunned by the rest of Daran's dwarf clans for destroying perfectly good pieces of junk.
cards.name: Ironsmash Wrecker
cards.text: When Ironsmash Wrecker enters the battlefield, you may destroy target artifact.

cards.flavor: “Why do we fight you ask? We fight because we can. Nothing more, nothing less.”
cards.name: Itava Outrider
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)

cards.name: Itava Scourge
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Whenever a creature you control becomes blocked by a creature, Itava Scourge deals 1 damage to that creature's controller.

cards.name: Itava Warshrieker
cards.text:
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
Itava Warshrieker attacks each combat if able.

cards.name: Javelin

Equipped creature gets +2/+0 and has “{T}, Unattach Javelin: It deals 2 damage to target creature.”

Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
When Kalime Charger enters the battlefield, you may have another target creature you control gain trample until end of turn.

cards.flavor: So strong was his devotion to his men that Vaea granted him new life as a leader of a spirit army.

cards.text:
Other creatures you control get +1/+1.

cards.flavor: In her heart she spins the world into its primal, ideal state.

cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts a noncreature spell, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control.

cards.flavor:
“All life is sacred. That's why I want it all to myself!”
—Sedis, Disciple of Nazgur

rulings.text: If you sacrifice Leech Soul's target to cast it, it will be countered as it tries to resolve.

cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.

cards.flavor:
“Some people may not like Grancel Library's ghost population, but I think they're nice enough for being dead.”
—Arden

cards.name: Life's Harbinger
cards.text:

cards.flavor: Life finds a way.

Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gains +X/+X, where X is your life total.

cards.name: Lifespinner Spider
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Whenever Lifespinner Spider blocks or becomes blocked by a creature with flying, you gain 1 life.

cards.flavor:

—Iva, Galvanomancer

cards.name: Lord of Swarms

Flying
{1}{W}: Target creature with a +1/+1 counter on it gains flying until end of turn.

cards.flavor: He does his best to make sure no one else can.
cards.name: Magister of Impotence
cards.text: Activated abilities of nonland permanents cost {2} more to activate.

cards.flavor: It prowls the Itava wastes, incinerating the goblins and beasts that wander around it.

rulings.text: If you somehow only control one land you can target, the ability will be countered.

cards.text:
Trample

cards.flavor: Aspiring to greatness, one musty tome at a time.
cards.name: Magus Aspirant
cards.text:
Prowess
When Magus Aspirant enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an instant or sorcery card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.

cards.name: Maligned Brute
cards.text:
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
Double strike (This creature deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)

cards.flavor: A source of power in a vessel of unpredictability.
cards.name: Mana Prism
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{1}, {T}: Add one mana of any color.

changes: 2023-10-01 — Updated the wording of cards that exile spells "as they resolve" to exile the spell "instead of putting it into your graveyard as it resolves."
cards.name: Master Spellwright
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell from your hand, you may cast an instant or sorcery card with mana value less than or equal to that spell's mana value from your graveyard without paying its mana cost. Exile that card instead of putting it into your graveyard as it resolves.

cards.name: Mausoleum Revenant
cards.text:
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
Whenever Mausoleum Revenant deals damage to a player, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.

cards.name: Mavisa, Wayfinder
cards.text:
[+1]: Untap up to two target creatures and/or lands.
[-2]: Choose a color. Draw cards equal to the number of creatures you control of the chosen color.
[-7]: Reveal the top ten cards of your library. Put all creature and land cards revealed this way onto the battlefield and the rest into your hand.

cards.name: Mavisa's Familar
cards.text: As long as you control another white creature, Mavisa's Familar has lifelink. The same is true for blue and flying, black and deathtouch, and red and trample.

cards.name: Meteorain
cards.text: Meteorain deals 5 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures or planeswalkers.

cards.name: Might of All
cards.text: Creatures you control gain flying until end of turn if you control a creature with flying. The same is true for first strike, double strike, haste, hexproof, indestructible, lifelink, trample, vigilance, and prowess.

cards.flavor: “Hyaaaaa!”
cards.name: Mighty Swing
cards.text: Target attacking creature gets +3/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Mind Crash
cards.text: Target player reveals their hand. You choose three cards from it and exile them. Then that player exiles the top three cards of their library.

cards.name: Mindbreaker Sphinx
cards.text:
Flying
If Mindbreaker Sphinx would deal combat damage to a player, you may prevent it. If you do, that player mills X cards, where X is Mindbreaker Sphinx's power. If two cards that share a card type were milled this way, put a +1/+1 counter on Mindbreaker Sphinx.

cards.flavor: You'll feel your mind break long before your body does.
cards.name: Mindwinder
cards.text:
Deathtouch
Whenever an opponent casts a noncreature spell, draw a card.

cards.name: Mist Lurker
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
When Mist Lurker enters the battlefield, tap all creatures you don't control.

cards.name: Mistwake Hydra
cards.text:
Mistwake Hydra enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
Creatures with power less than Mistwake Hydra's power can't block it.

cards.name: Monstrous Guise
cards.text:
Target creature you control gets +1/+0 and gains menace until end of turn. (That creature can only be blocked by two or more creatures.)
Draw a card.

cards.name: Moonlit Shore
cards.text:
Moonlit Shore enters the battlefield tapped unless you control two or more blue and/or black permanents.
{T}: Add {U} or {B}.

cards.flavor: The best treasures—to a necromancer at least—are those who never considered themselves treasures at all.
cards.name: Morbid Plunder
cards.text: Return up to two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor:
“Now Daril, the essence of stealth is simple. Move with intention and purpose so that they'll think you were always meant to be there.”
—Amelia, Aeon's Hand Assassin
cards.name: Move Unseen
cards.text: Target creature can't be blocked this turn.

cards.flavor:
“The Aeon's Hand will share my pain! You monsters!”
—Daril Tique
cards.name: Murderous Rampage
cards.text: Destroy target creature an opponent controls, then that player sacrifices a creature.

cards.flavor: The Natia Valley is one of the key routes many nomadic tribes pass when the seasons change.
cards.name: Natia Nomad
cards.text: Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)

cards.flavor:
“Though they may talk of things like spirituality, the Leonin of Natia Valley are no more than savages crudely wearing the veneer of civilization.”
—Gavis, Stalwart
cards.name: Natia Shaman
Nimbus Fae
cards.text:
Flying
{3}{U}, Sacrifice Nimbus Fae: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.

cards.name: Northwind Master
cards.text:
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
When Northwind Master enters the battlefield, you may have another target creature you control gain prowess until end of turn.

cards.name: Ophelia's Neophyte
cards.text:
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
When Ophelia's Neophyte enters the battlefield, you may have another target creature you control gain lifelink until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Their shells contain the secrets of fate itself.
cards.name: Oracle Crab
cards.text: When Oracle Crab enters the battlefield, scry 2. (To scry 2, look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

cards.flavor: When the wild calls, listen or be trampled into the dust.
cards.name: Overwhelming Force
cards.text: Creatures you control get +3/+3 until end of turn and creatures your opponents control block this turn if able.

cards.name: Paladin's Blade
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+1 and has vigilance and lifelink.
Equip {3}

cards.name: Palloren Vulture
cards.text:
Flying
When Palloren Vulture enters the battlefield, each player mills two cards.

cards.name: Planar Processor
cards.text:
{T}, Sacrifice a creature: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
{T}, Sacrifice an artifact: Planar Processor deals 1 damage to any target.
{T}, Sacrifice an enchantment: Draw a card.
{T}, Sacrifice a land: Add one mana of any color.

cards.flavor: The cry of death is the dinner bell of the scavengers.
cards.name: Predatory Feast
cards.text: Choose a creature. When it dies this turn, distribute two +1/+1 counters among any number of creatures you control.

cards.name: Prey Upon
cards.text: Target creature you control fights target creature you don't control. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)

cards.name: Priest of Profanities
cards.text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Each opponent loses 2 life. You gain life equal to the life lost this way.

cards.name: Primal Evocation
cards.text: Reveal the top seven cards of your library. You may put a creature card from among them onto the battlefield. Put the rest into your graveyard. Then flip a coin. If you win the flip, return Primal Evocation to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Prophetic Flame
cards.text:
Haste
When Prophetic Flame dies, scry 1. (To scry 1, look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

cards.flavor: “The strings of fate pull at us all.”
cards.name: Pull the Strings
cards.text:
You may tap or untap target permanent.
Scry 1.

cards.name: Pummel
cards.text: Target creature gets +1/+0 and gains double strike until end of turn. (It deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)

cards.flavor: “Dance, my pathetic plaything, dance!”
cards.name: Puppetize
cards.text:
Enchant creature
{U}: Tap enchanted creature.
{1}{U}: Untap enchanted creature and gain control of it until end of turn.

cards.flavor: The other barbarian clans knew to fear the Itava, for their leader could wield pure devastation as easily as they could wield their axes.
cards.name: Pyrostorm
cards.text: Pyrostorm deals 10 damage divided as you choose among any number of targets.

cards.flavor:
“Behold! This is the face of the absolute!”
—Nabras, King of Goldhill
cards.name: Radiant Justicar
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a creature you don't control deals damage, its controller sacrifices it unless that player pays {2}.

cards.flavor:
“Seek the new in the familiar. Only then will your education bear fruit.”
—Mavisa, Wanderer
cards.name: Recall to Mind
cards.text:
Return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor: “Let's try that again!”
cards.name: Redo
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays its mana cost. (For example, if a spell costs {1}{U}{U}, its controller must pay {1}{U}{U}.)

cards.flavor:
“As it was, so too will it be. As the forest lays itself bare, so too will the seasons restore it to its former glory.”
—Mavisa, Wanderer
cards.name: Rejuvenation
cards.text:
Untap all basic lands you control.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor: Hatred is all it has left.

cards.text: {B}: Revenant Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
“Come my child, and be born anew from the earth's filthy cradle!”
—Aldrane, the Blackhearted
cards.name: Rise from the Grave
cards.text: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. That creature is a black Zombie in addition to its other colors and types.

cards.name: Roar of War
cards.text: Creatures you control get +2/+0 and gain menace until end of turn. (They can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)

cards.flavor:
“Even in death the essence of the fallen can be used for more productive things.”
—Kusore
cards.name: Rot Rebirth
cards.text: Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token for each nonland permanent card in your graveyard.

cards.flavor: The awakening of the undead hordes isn't exactly the prettiest thing in the world... or the cleanest.
cards.name: Rouse from Below
cards.text: Destroy target land. Create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.

cards.name: Rule of Nature

rulings.text: If there are no other creatures and you give a creature +1/+1, it will fight itself, dealing damage equal to twice its power to itself.

cards.text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may have it get +1/+1 until end of turn. If you do, it fights target creature. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)

cards.flavor: The light of divinity is both a shield and a blessing to those who need it.

cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{W}, {T}: You gain 1 life.

cards.name: Rush of Thought
cards.text: Exile the top two cards of your library. Until the end of your next turn, you may play those cards. (If you cast a spell this way, you still pay its costs. You can play a land this way only if you have an available land play remaining.)

cards.name: Sagi's Revenant
cards.text:
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
Whenever Sagi's Revenant deals combat damage to a player, that player discards a card.
Whenever an opponent discards a land card, you may have target creature get -2/-2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Sagi Aysan

rulings.text: You do not need to have a creature card in your graveyard to activate Sagi Aysan's +1, and you may cast a creature card that is put into your graveyard this turn after you activate it.

cards.text:
[+1]: Until end of turn, you may cast a creature card from your graveyard. Creature spells cast this way cost {2} less to cast.
[-2]: Each player discards a card. For each player who discarded a creature card this way, create a 2/1 black Horror creature token.
[-6]: For each player, you may put a creature card from that player's graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.

cards.flavor: Sometimes, one finds the clarity they need by looking inwards.

cards.name: Sanguine Mortifier

Flying, lifelink
Whenever you gain life, you may have target creature get -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the amount of life you gained.

cards.flavor: The beings of Itur have been known to grow to gigantic sizes. Some creatures have grown so big to be mistaken as mountain ranges.
cards.name: Scaled Wurm

cards.flavor: “They say faith can move mountains. I personally prefer to use magic instead.”

cards.flavor: “May you hold your shield firm, to protect all that you hold dear.”

Enchant creature

cards.flavor: At that moment, there were no armies allies, or orders; just warriors and the slaughter.
cards.name: Shifting Allegiances
cards.text: Exile all nontoken creatures. For each creature exiled this way, return that card to the battlefield under a random player's control.

cards.flavor: The violent mana storms tend to leave unpredictable destruction in their wake.

cards.flavor:
“Take a look, pawn. Look at all the lives you ended thanks to this little plot of yours!”

cards.flavor:
“Brothers! Behold the true fruit of nature itself; beings that make us look insignificant by comparison!”

You may look at and play cards exiled with Thought Siphon, and you may spend blue mana as though it were mana of any color to cast them.

cards.flavor:
“The cycle o' life and death is inexorable and unchangin'. A mighty beautiful thing, if I say so myself.”

cards.name: Travian Archsage

Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever you cast your first instant or sorcery spell each turn, copy that spell. You may choose new targets for the copies.
